description.value: Responses to the PHQ-plus are interpreted using the numbers following each response option below. title.value: Secondary Screen [Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS) Screen]

description.value: The secondary screen (C-SSRS screen) must be evaluated based on a step-wise analysis of question answers as described in the behaviors below. Adapted from Posner 2009 and Tri-Service Workflow 2017. Select one response per question.The timeframe for questions 1 through 5 is within the past month

title.value: The timeframe for questions 1 through 5 is within the past month
Wish to be dead: Person endorses thoughts about a wish to be dead or not alive anymore, or wish to fall asleep and not wake up.

prompt.value: 1. Patient response to "Have you wished you were dead or wished you could go to sleep and not wake up?"

title.value: Suicidal thoughts: General non-specific thoughts of wanting to end one’s life/die by suicide, “I’ve thought about killing myself” without general thoughts of ways to kill oneself/associated methods, intent, or plan.

prompt.value: 2. Patient response to: "Have you actually had any thoughts of killing yourself?"

title.value: Suicidal thoughts with method (without specific plan or intent to act): Person endorses thoughts of suicide and has thought of at least one method during the assessment period.

description.value: This is different than a specific plan with time, place or method details worked out. "I thought about taking an overdose, but I never made a specific plan as to when where or how I would actually do it....and I would never go through with it."

prompt.value: 3. Patient response to "Have you been thinking about how you might do this?"

title.value: Suicidal intent (without specific plan): Active suicidal thoughts of killing oneself and patient reports having some intent to act on such thoughts, as opposed to "I have the thoughts, but I definitely will not do anything about them."

prompt.value: 4. Have you had these thoughts and had some intention of acting on them?

title.value: Suicide intent with specific plan: Thoughts of killing oneself with details of plan fully or partially worked out and person has some intent to carry it out.

prompt.value: 5. Patient response to "have you had these thoughts and had some intention of acting on them? Have you started to work out or worked out the details of how to kill yourself? Do you intend to carry out this plan?"

title.value: The timeframe for question 6a is the patient’s entire lifetime

prompt.value: 6a. Patient response to: "Have you ever done anything, started to do anything, or prepared to do anything to end your life? Examples: Collected pills, obtained a gun, gave away valuables, wrote a will or suicide note, took out pills but didn’t swallow any, held a gun but changed your mind or it was grabbed from your hand, went to the roof but didn’t jump; or actually took pills, tried to shoot yourself, cut yourself, tried to hang yourself, etc."

title.value: The timeframe for question 6b is the past 3 months

prompt.value: 6b. Were any of these in the past 3 months?
